subject: service root: add ProtocolFeaturesSupported
commitMessage:
service root: add ProtocolFeaturesSupported

This commits adds a dummy ProtocolFeaturesSupported object in the
service root. It indicates that none of the Query Parameter is
supported. Future commits will add supports for OnlyMemberQuery,
ExpandQuery, and so on.

Tested:
1. unit test
2. passed QEMU Redfish (which contains Redfish Validator) test

This commit is split from these changes:
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/38952
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/47474
Credits to maxiaochao@inspur.com, ed@tanous.net, and
zhanghch05@inspur.com.

Signed-off-by: Nan Zhou <nanzhoumails@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Ed Tanous <edtanous@google.com>
Change-Id: I81ff856514528f63a462558a8f18fefe4369edae

Omitting deep operations is legal when the service doesn't support deep operations according to the spec.

"Services that support deep PATCH for updating resources shall set the value of the DeepPATCH property in the
DeepOperations property in the ProtocolFeaturesSupported property within the service root to true ."

Also DMTF's public mockup omits deep operations, https://github.com/DMTF/Redfish/blob/master/mockups/public-bladed/index.json#L7

Omitting all of those properties is legal, my point is we should be consistent: either

A. When we don't support a feature we omit the property.
or
B. When we don't support a feature, we add the property set to false.

Does that make sense?

I'm pretty sure that mockup was created before DeepOperations was in the standard.

With that said, I'm not that worried about DeepOperations.
Okay, so add DeepOperations and set them to false to keep consistent?
Yeah, that works for me;  FWIW, I don't have a strong opinion between A and B, but we should be consistent.
Most codes are using "" style for local headers. So I changed them in this PR.
Please don't do it in this PR;  We're also wildly inconsistent in this regard.  Lets keep this patchset focused on ProtocolFeaturesSupported.
FWYI, I rebased this into the query series because some of the other patches needed it.  I'm hoping to merge the series all as one shot.

MaxLevels might be useful here in the future. Don't expect it here, this is just an FYI. 
From https://redfish.dmtf.org/schemas/v1/ServiceRoot.v1_13_0.json 

            "properties": {
                "ExpandAll": {
                    "description": "An indication of whether the service supports the asterisk (`*`) option of the $expand query parameter.",
                    "longDescription": "This property shall indicate whether this service supports the asterisk (`*`) option of the $expand query parameter.",
                    "readonly": true,
                    "type": "boolean",
                    "versionAdded": "v1_3_0"
                },
                "Levels": {
                    "description": "An indication of whether the service supports the $levels option of the $expand query parameter.",
                    "longDescription": "This property shall indicate whether the service supports the $levels option of the $expand query parameter.",
                    "readonly": true,
                    "type": "boolean",
                    "versionAdded": "v1_3_0"
                },
                "Links": {
                    "description": "An indication of whether this service supports the tilde (`~`) option of the $expand query parameter.",
                    "longDescription": "This property shall indicate whether this service supports the supports the tilde (~) option of the $expand query parameter.",
                    "readonly": true,
                    "type": "boolean",
                    "versionAdded": "v1_3_0"
                },
                "MaxLevels": {
                    "description": "The maximum $levels option value in the $expand query parameter.",
                    "longDescription": "This property shall contain the maximum $levels option value in the $expand query parameter.  Shall be included only if $levels is true.",
                    "maximum": 6,
                    "minimum": 1,
                    "readonly": true,
                    "type": "integer",
                    "versionAdded": "v1_3_0"
                },
                "NoLinks": {
                    "description": "An indication of whether the service supports the period (`.`) option of the $expand query parameter.",
                    "longDescription": "This property shall indicate whether the service supports the period (`.`) option of the $expand query parameter.",
                    "readonly": true,
                    "type": "boolean",
                    "versionAdded": "v1_3_0"
                }
            },

Ack.

Yes, when enabling $expand, we shall set MaxLevels according to the spec.

But MaxLevels can't be set if expand is not supported according to the spec.
When we decide on a max depth (if any) we can and should set this, but I suspect that's going to involve lots of testing from people.
+1.  I forgot we were doing that elsewhere.
Looks to me that all comments have been addressed and the functional code hasnt' changed since the last round of +1s.  Merging.
